title: SportScore
author: SportScore
content: Hey to all, so I'm in Thailand and I have used someone service to convert crypto to cash, and it was so amazing and fast!I want to recommend it for everyone who need cash in Thailand for crypto 100% safe! https://www.globimmo.net/en/bitcoin/phuket/62988315694cea2b7347dc16.crypto#7.88178|98.3329|16

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: SportScore on April 28, 2023, 10:59:59 AMHey to all, so I'm in Thailand and I have used someone service to convert crypto to cash, and it was so amazing and fast!I want to recommend it for everyone who need cash in Thailand for crypto 100% safe! I'm sorry to be rude, but you are a newbie account without any trust list, and therefore we cannot trust what you are trying to say, just as the link that you are trying to provide does not indicate anything.There are many P2P trading platforms, you can ask him to create an account there like Bisq.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: SportScore on April 28, 2023, 10:59:59 AMHey to all, so I'm in Thailand and I have used someone service to convert crypto to cash, and it was so amazing and fast!I want to recommend it for everyone who need cash in Thailand for crypto 100% safe! https://www.globimmo.net/en/bitcoin/phuket/62988315694cea2b7347dc16.crypto#7.88178|98.3329|16Based on your post you seem to be a tourist, why not show your face or create a video and blog the service, the community is suspicious when we see something like this recommending something that is unfamiliar to us, unfortunately, we don't have a Thailand local board here, but I hope one Thailander member with a good reputation here or even someone residing in Thailander with a good reputation here can vouch on the service you are promoting.

comments.author: Taskford
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on April 29, 2023, 10:51:13 AMQuote from: SportScore on April 28, 2023, 10:59:59 AMHey to all, so I'm in Thailand and I have used someone service to convert crypto to cash, and it was so amazing and fast!I want to recommend it for everyone who need cash in Thailand for crypto 100% safe! I'm sorry to be rude, but you are a newbie account without any trust list, and therefore we cannot trust what you are trying to say, just as the link that you are trying to provide does not indicate anything.There are many P2P trading platforms, you can ask him to create an account there like Bisq.Some of them use flowery sentence just to highlight bitcoin on their extra curricular activities then post it here maybe to get merits. But its little much unbelievable that he really use pure bitcoin on his travel since bitcoin is not been announce as legal tender on that country so provably a bitcoin user in that place will struggle to find merchant accepts bitcoin as mode of payment. For sure there's fiat use in that travel since this is more convenient currency for now to used by any travelers.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: I think you better provide significant information as to the service you're talking about. What is it? Does it require KYC? Is it a custodial service? Is it a P2P app? Actually, if all you have is crypto and you visit my country, you can also do that. There is no big deal here. The most popular crypto app in my country is also present in Thailand. I don't know how widely adopted it is there, though. The big deal is if you can visit Thailand and tour around the country spending only crypto. But if you have to convert your crypto to fiat first, you probably can do that with several options. You can also to that in a number of countries.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Quote from: Taskford on April 29, 2023, 12:18:36 PMBut its little much unbelievable that he really use pure bitcoin on his travel since bitcoin is not been announce as legal tender on that country so provably a bitcoin user in that place will struggle to find merchant accepts bitcoin as mode of payment. For sure there's fiat use in that travel since this is more convenient currency for now to used by any travelers.OP worded it poorly. From the looks of it, they merely sold their bitcoins for cash so this isn't about merchants accepting bitcoin as a payment. In fact, last I heard Thailand banned it and I haven't seen any retractment of statement, see: https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/thailand-ban-use-digital-assets-payments-april-sec-2022-03-23/

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: Quote from: SportScore on April 28, 2023, 10:59:59 AMHey to all, so I'm in Thailand and I have used someone service to convert crypto to cash, and it was so amazing and fast!I want to recommend it for everyone who need cash in Thailand for crypto 100% safe! Bro, your links seem to be a scam as you have put some specific port number at the end of the link which can lead to your created environment which could look like a copy of your mentioned platform and bad things could happen (not accusing) just stating the fact.Plus I think you should get some trust and merit too, because in the crypto space, no one likes to click on links that are shared by newbies because a single click can cause a lot of trouble to them I also avoid clicking on it. Plus it would be more generic if you would add your conversion screenshots so that we can confirm it or at least transaction id etc.

comments.author: cabron
comments.body: Quote from: SportScore on April 28, 2023, 10:59:59 AMHey to all, so I'm in Thailand and I have used someone service to convert crypto to cash, and it was so amazing and fast!I want to recommend it for everyone who need cash in Thailand for crypto 100% safe! https://www.globimmo.net/en/bitcoin/phuket/62988315694cea2b7347dc16.crypto#7.88178|98.3329|16Technically you can covert coins to cash in any country as long as crypto isn't banned to whcih you can live to such country paying cash.But have you tried paying services directly using BTC? Because if yes, thats what adoption is. Eliminating cash.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Technically you're not spending only crypto since you just convert it to cash and used it whatever you did.And, what's the link for?

comments.author: Taskford
comments.body: Quote from: Potato Chips on April 29, 2023, 01:20:30 PMQuote from: Taskford on April 29, 2023, 12:18:36 PMBut its little much unbelievable that he really use pure bitcoin on his travel since bitcoin is not been announce as legal tender on that country so provably a bitcoin user in that place will struggle to find merchant accepts bitcoin as mode of payment. For sure there's fiat use in that travel since this is more convenient currency for now to used by any travelers.OP worded it poorly. From the looks of it, they merely sold their bitcoins for cash so this isn't about merchants accepting bitcoin as a payment. In fact, last I heard Thailand banned it and I haven't seen any retractment of statement, see: https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/thailand-ban-use-digital-assets-payments-april-sec-2022-03-23/Yeah that's why its ridiculous claim that he only use crypto since so far this currency is not well acknowledge by big merchants. If he only point out on El Salvador maybe people will really find this story amazing. So for sure fiat is really needed on this travel since he really get a hard time to search for merchant which accept bitcoin directly. Hopefully this will happen into that country or globally but this is long legal battle where bitcoin need to pass on.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: Taskford on April 29, 2023, 12:18:36 PMSome of them use flowery sentence just to highlight bitcoin on their extra curricular activities then post it here maybe to get merits. If this is a new way to get merits, people are desperate about the merit system, I hope that it is an attempt to share *another amazing Bitcoin payment story*I saw many videos for people who used bitcoin only to travel, but they were well planned visit with an additional balance of the dollar, which was transferred from Bitcoin to Cash.So it is possible if the trip is well planned.

comments.author: traderethereum
comments.body: It's best to be careful contacting the person @OP refers to as that person is on Telegram.Not that I suspect him but we know many scammers are looking for their victims from Telegram and we also don't know who he really is.If someone wants to travel to another place and use or exchange his bitcoins, he must have already exchanged his bitcoins before he started his journey.And I'm sure that people who have already converted their bitcoin to fiat already have their favorite places even if they don't want to travel anywhere else.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: Recently, I traveled to Thailand and attempted to utilize my cryptocurrency. However, to my dismay, I was unable to find any reliable sources to spend my digital assets. While I cannot verify the veracity of your claims, I find it challenging to trust someone who is new to the subject matter. If you are interested in using this service, I advise you to exercise caution. Alternatively, you may consider utilizing a reputable peer-to-peer platform to convert your cryptocurrency into fiat currency.

comments.author: virasog
comments.body: Quote from: SportScore on April 28, 2023, 10:59:59 AMHey to all, so I'm in Thailand and I have used someone service to convert crypto to cash, and it was so amazing and fast!I want to recommend it for everyone who need cash in Thailand for crypto 100% safe! Converting crypto to cash is not difficult in any country as long as there is P2P platform exists. In most Asian countries, people just use binance or any exchange to convert their crypto to cash without any hassle. The real and amazing thing would be when you will be able to spend crypto directly in any country without converting it into fiat.Also, i do not think anyone should click on the link you pasted. I do not think anyone should click on it. I feel something is wrong with it, I haven't clicked it myself.

comments.author: SportScore
comments.body: Hey all thanks for the reply and yeah the post was created fast without good information as I'm on vacation, I just google Bitcoin atm on thailand and found this guy he amazing person, I send him Crypto and he give me code to withdraw money from any ATM around Thailand.So I just want to give him a huge thanks for everything he done for me.I don't asked you to click , you can Google it also.I asked the owner of the exchange to comment here to explain more about his service.

comments.author: usdt-thb.com
comments.created_time: May 02, 2023, 06:12:55 AMLast edit: May 02, 2023, 06:29:23 AM by usdt-thb.com
comments.body: Quote from: SportScore on April 28, 2023, 10:59:59 AMHey to all, so I'm in Thailand and I have used someone service to convert crypto to cash, and it was so amazing and fast!I want to recommend it for everyone who need cash in Thailand for crypto 100% safe! https://www.globimmo.net/en/bitcoin/phuket/62988315694cea2b7347dc16.crypto#7.88178|98.3329|16GM sir.It was a pleasure to work with you. Thank you for your positive review about our services and we are looking forward to cooperate with you again.I didn't have an account at this forum but it looks like that local community is active here.I hope to be useful for the community in the mission of mass adoption.My duty now is to ask my exchange partners to write a few words about their experience of using one of our services.Few words about the exchange that was kindly mentioned:First listing was made at https://www.globimmo.net/en/bitcoin/koh-samui/5cad9116214a69443e00000f.cryptoIt was in 2018. Few more listings were added later.In the end of 2022 we were launched a web page https://www.usdt-thb.comThe process of the exchange is easy and fast:1. Transfer crypto to the wallet of exchanger2. Receive credentials for withdrawal3. Withdraw Thai Cash in any ATM all over Thailand.If you want to exchange or you have any questions please contact us via:Telegram: @AntrBit or @DecentraThaiWhatsApp: +66980923396You all are mostly welcome and we are able to fulfill at least any request in Thailand via ATMs or Bank Transfer (payment for rental, for moto, auto or flight, even payment for purchasing of house is available).#Newbie life matters

comments.author: usdt-thb.com
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on April 29, 2023, 10:51:13 AMQuote from: SportScore on April 28, 2023, 10:59:59 AMHey to all, so I'm in Thailand and I have used someone service to convert crypto to cash, and it was so amazing and fast!I want to recommend it for everyone who need cash in Thailand for crypto 100% safe! I'm sorry to be rude, but you are a newbie account without any trust list, and therefore we cannot trust what you are trying to say, just as the link that you are trying to provide does not indicate anything.There are many P2P trading platforms, you can ask him to create an account there like Bisq.The platform you mentioned (Bisq) is not working with Thai Currency. Would you be so kind to provide us with other one that is able to provide it's customer with cash directly without any KYC or registration?Thank you in advance.

comments.author: usdt-thb.com
comments.created_time: May 02, 2023, 06:35:35 AMLast edit: May 13, 2023, 09:34:08 PM by Mr. Big
comments.body: Quote from: Taskford on April 29, 2023, 12:18:36 PMQuote from: hugeblack on April 29, 2023, 10:51:13 AMQuote from: SportScore on April 28, 2023, 10:59:59 AMHey to all, so I'm in Thailand and I have used someone service to convert crypto to cash, and it was so amazing and fast!I want to recommend it for everyone who need cash in Thailand for crypto 100% safe! For sure there's fiat use in that travel since this is more convenient currency for now to used by any travelers.Thank you for your reply.You're exactly right - bitcoin is not allowed and a way of payment here (just few places). But this customer didn't spend any fiat from his bank account of cash that he bring with him from the home country.The main idea of this post was that you don't need credit card of cash when coming to Thailand. You can pay everywhere via our services and you can receive cash everywhere in Thailand too. Thus you can come with crypto only and everything will be arranged and paid.I described the flow here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5450484.msg62181447#msg62181447Quote from: Faisal2202 on April 29, 2023, 01:25:48 PMQuote from: SportScore on April 28, 2023, 10:59:59 AMHey to all, so I'm in Thailand and I have used someone service to convert crypto to cash, and it was so amazing and fast!I want to recommend it for everyone who need cash in Thailand for crypto 100% safe! Plus it would be more generic if you would add your conversion screenshots so that we can confirm it or at least transaction id etc. Hey bro. It is not a port number - it is longtitude and latitude from the map. The URL is leading to the listing on the map.BTW - it is short link also https://www.usdt-thb.com#Newbie life mattersQuote from: coin-investor on April 29, 2023, 11:59:10 AMQuote from: SportScore on April 28, 2023, 10:59:59 AMHey to all, so I'm in Thailand and I have used someone service to convert crypto to cash, and it was so amazing and fast!I want to recommend it for everyone who need cash in Thailand for crypto 100% safe! https://www.globimmo.net/en/bitcoin/phuket/62988315694cea2b7347dc16.crypto#7.88178|98.3329|16Based on your post you seem to be a tourist, why not show your face or create a video and blog the service, the community is suspicious when we see something like this recommending something that is unfamiliar to us, unfortunately, we don't have a Thailand local board here, but I hope one Thailander member with a good reputation here or even someone residing in Thailander with a good reputation here can vouch on the service you are promoting.BTW - don't rely on good reputation here: https://www.playerup.com/accounts/bitcointalkaccount/It's not so expensive

comments.author: Taskford
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on April 30, 2023, 11:31:26 AMQuote from: Taskford on April 29, 2023, 12:18:36 PMSome of them use flowery sentence just to highlight bitcoin on their extra curricular activities then post it here maybe to get merits. If this is a new way to get merits, people are desperate about the merit system, I hope that it is an attempt to share *another amazing Bitcoin payment story*I saw many videos for people who used bitcoin only to travel, but they were well planned visit with an additional balance of the dollar, which was transferred from Bitcoin to Cash.So it is possible if the trip is well planned.Merit is hard to earn so I'm not really surprised for some users creates unrealistic claim to boost up their post and then trying to get some attention of many reputable users here. But unfortunately many people doesn't like to hear make up stories that's why he didn't get much praise but instead many people trying to correct some wrongs perspective about what's the real deal on that country.I see a vlogger trying to use bitcoin only on Boracay Philippines but at the end of his video he said that he really get a hard time to find service and merchant which accept bitcoin directly on that place .

comments.author: doomloop
comments.body: Quote from: SportScore on April 28, 2023, 10:59:59 AMHey to all, so I'm in Thailand and I have used someone service to convert crypto to cash, and it was so amazing and fast!I want to recommend it for everyone who need cash in Thailand for crypto 100% safe! That title is pretty misleading. I thought this is a thread about OP traveling to Thailand and spending cryptocurrencies everywhere in Thailand and it must be some interesting story and how everyone in Thailand accepts cryptocurrencies as payment for goods and services, it was disappointing to find out after opening the thread that it's nothing more than an advertisement.I wonder why someone in Thailand or any country shouldn't use an online P2P service instead of using a service by an individual who would come and hand out the cash to you. That's super creepy knowing it can also be dangerous since you are in an unknown country and the other person knows you got money on you.
